workflow.name: Stripe customer duplicate detection & management with Airtable & Slack notifications
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically scan your Stripe customers daily to detect duplicates and keep your customer database clean. This workflow uses advanced fuzzy matching for emails and names, logs results to Airtable for review, and notifies your team in Slack with actionable insights. üí≥üßπüí¨

## What This Template Does
- Runs every day at 2:00 AM via scheduled trigger ‚è∞
- Fetches all customers from Stripe üí≥
- Analyzes for potential duplicates using email and name similarity üîç
- Logs duplicate suggestions into Airtable for review üìä
- Sends formatted Slack notifications with detailed reports üí¨

## Key Benefits
- Keeps your Stripe customer database clean and deduplicated üßπ
- Reduces errors in reporting and billing üíµ
- Provides confidence scoring for duplicate matches üîë
- Centralized review and approval in Airtable üìã
- Real-time team notifications in Slack with actionable insights üì≤

## Features
- Daily 2 AM schedule with cron expression 0 2 * * *
- Email-based duplicate detection üìß
- Name similarity matching using Levenshtein distance üë§
- Smart grouping: oldest record becomes the primary üè∑Ô∏è
- Logs duplicates to Airtable with status tracking üîÑ
- Slack notifications with statistics, match types, and Airtable link ‚ö°

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- Stripe API credentials with customer read access
- Airtable account with a table for duplicate tracking
- Slack App & Bot Token with chat:write permission
- Target Audience
- SaaS companies managing large Stripe customer databases üè¢
- Finance and billing teams wanting clean records üí∞
- Support teams reducing customer confusion from duplicates üéß
- Growth and marketing teams ensuring CRM accuracy üìà
- Any business that relies on Stripe for recurring billing üíº

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Set up Stripe API credentials in n8n (use your Secret Key).
- Create an Airtable base and table with required fields (Customer IDs, Email, Similarity Score, Status).
- Add Slack API credentials and choose your target channel.
- Replace environment variables for Airtable (AIRTABLE_BASE_ID, AIRTABLE_TABLE_ID) and Slack (SLACK_CHANNEL_ID).
- Import this workflow into n8n and connect your credentials.
- Run the workflow once manually to validate data flows.
- Enable the workflow for daily automated duplicate detection. ‚úÖ

parameters.content:
## üéØ Stripe Customer Duplicate Detection & Management

This workflow automatically scans your Stripe customers daily to identify potential duplicates and helps you maintain a clean customer database.

### What this workflow does:
‚Ä¢ Fetches all customers from Stripe daily at 2 AM
‚Ä¢ Uses advanced fuzzy matching to detect duplicates by email and name
‚Ä¢ Logs findings to Airtable for review and approval
‚Ä¢ Sends detailed Slack notifications with actionable insights

### Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Email-based duplicate detection (99% confidence)
‚Ä¢ Name similarity matching using Levenshtein distance
‚Ä¢ Automated logging with status tracking
‚Ä¢ Smart grouping and prioritization
‚Ä¢ Detailed Slack reports with statistics

### Setup Requirements:
1. Stripe API credentials
2. Airtable base with duplicate tracking table
3. Slack workspace integration

## ‚è∞ Daily Trigger Setup

Scheduled to run every day at 2 AM to avoid peak business hours.

**Cron Expression:** `0 2 * * *`
- 0: minute (0)
- 2: hour (2 AM)
- *: any day of month
- *: any month
- *: any day of week

üí° **Tip:** You can modify the schedule based on your timezone and business needs.

## üí≥ Stripe Customer Fetch

Retrieves all customers from your Stripe account for duplicate analysis.

**Setup Steps:**
1. Create Stripe API credentials in n8n
2. Use your Stripe Secret Key (starts with sk_)
3. Ensure the key has read permissions for customers

**Security Note:** Never hardcode API keys - always use n8n credentials manager.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** This fetches ALL customers. For large datasets (10k+ customers), consider adding pagination or filters.

## üîç Duplicate Detection Logic

Advanced algorithm that identifies potential duplicates using:

**Email Matching (99% confidence):**
- Exact email matches across customers
- Case-insensitive comparison
- Highest priority for merging

**Name Similarity (80%+ threshold):**
- Uses Levenshtein distance algorithm
- Handles typos and variations
- Configurable similarity threshold

**Smart Grouping:**
- Oldest customer becomes primary
- All others suggested for merge
- Prevents duplicate processing

The algorithm processes customers efficiently and avoids false positives.

## üìä Airtable Logging Setup

Logs all duplicate suggestions to Airtable for review and approval workflow.

**Required Table Fields:**
- Primary Customer ID (Text)
- Secondary Customer ID (Text)
- Email (Email)
- Name Similarity Score (Number)
- Primary Name (Text)
- Secondary Name (Text)
- Match Reason (Single Select)
- Status (Single Select: Pending Review, Approved, Rejected)

**Setup Steps:**
1. Create Airtable Personal Access Token
2. Replace the hardcoded base and table IDs with your own
3. Set up the table structure as described above

## üìù Message Formatting

Creates a detailed Slack message with:

**Summary Statistics:**
- Total duplicate suggestions found
- Number of customer groups affected
- Total customers involved

**Match Type Breakdown:**
- Email matches (highest confidence)
- Name similarity matches
- Combined email + name matches

**Top Duplicate Groups:**
- Shows the most problematic duplicates
- Includes customer count per group
- Limited to top 3 for readability

**Action Items:**
- Direct link to Airtable for review
- Clear next steps for the team

## üí¨ Slack Notification Setup

Sends detailed duplicate reports to your team Slack channel.

**Setup Steps:**
1. Create Slack App with Bot Token
2. Add bot to your target channel
3. Replace hardcoded channel ID with your channel
4. Grant necessary permissions (chat:write)

**Message Features:**
- Markdown formatting for better readability
- Emoji indicators for different match types
- Direct links to Airtable for action
- Summary statistics for quick overview

**Security:** Use environment variables for sensitive channel IDs and tokens.

üí° **Tip:** Consider using different channels for different alert levels.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
